At my school, we had agendas that had a section that a teacher could sign to allow you to go to the bathroom,  or the main office, etc.The staff were always on watch and if you didn't have a pass or a signed planner, then they made sure to check if you were skipping. So when I skipped, and I was going in between buildings, I just made sure to have my planner out . Just in case they wanted to make sure, I forged the signature of my teacher of that specific period.Not very well, but just enough to convince a skimming eye.

I worked out the mathematical equation on how many days and/or classes I could skip and still graduate. Due to this, there were days when I'd not even leave the house. And there were days when I'd go for the few essential classes, then leave after. Sometimes, I just went to check out a new book. Then promptly left again. I knew every nook and cranny of that school so I knew EXACTLY where to hide and exactly which routes to take in order to leave without anybody stopping me. I was also a master of deception. There were times when I simply walked out the front doors. The key is to grow your beard out, dress profesionally and act like a sub. Nobody's going to question a sub leaving! Needless to say, I was a MASTER at skipping.

In Canada, your parents CAN be called home for skipping periods. When you come back to class, you may be asked to hand a note from your parent to show they knew you weren't at school, when you couldn't give one, you'd have to call home, when you couldn't do THAT you got detention or suspension.
